bibl.title: Letter from James E. Peabody to Philip Showalter Hench, September 30, 1940

div1.p: Peabody will write to the Welch Medical Library and ask that the research material he left there be sent to Hench.

div1.head: Letter from James E. Peabody to Philip Showalter Hench, September 30, 1940
div1.opener:
281 LOWELL AVENUE
NEWTONVILLE, MASSACHUSETTS
Sept. 30, 1940.
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
Mayo Clinic,
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:-
div1.p:
Yours of the 12th, and the 26th, of
this month just received. I am
sending a letter to the librarian
of the Welch Medical Library, expressing
the hope that they be willing to
send the material to you by express.
I trust you may find it of some use
in the preparation of your address.
Your trip to Havana resulted most
fortunately, and your contribution
to the story of the conquest of yellow
fever will I am sure, prove valua-
ble indeed.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, James E. Peabody.
